result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin P Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber if imposed. May transfer to Rock County.

miscConds.notes:
As of 12/27/2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.  Department of Corrections to address financial obligations related to DNA surcharge.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No Contact with co-defendant. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if imposed. May transfer to Rock County.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commence 11/28/14 by 05:00pm.
12-02-2014 LAST 15 DAYS ARE STAYED. MAY TRANSFER TO ROCK COUNTY.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with Attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Harrington makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following: 

COUNT 1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:        **CONSECUTIVE**

6 MONTHS HUBER    **Transfer allowed to Rock County**

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS           **Transfer allowed to Rock County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalis 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant  

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:        **CONSECUTIVE**

3 MONTHS HUBER    **Transfer allowed to Rock County**

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS         **Transfer allowed to Rock County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalis 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: Co-Defendant  

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 DAYS -LAST 15 DAYS STAYED- Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 11/28/14 by 5:00 p.m. -May be served at Rock County jail (huber)
Letter from University of Wisconsin-Rock County and letter/e-mail from Defendant's father
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington. Atty Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by the Court. Atty Harrington requests a plea and sentencing date. Atty Harrington withdraws his Motion. Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Motion hearing on October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
(Orig.) ... to suppress. Exhibits attached. Filed by Atty Harrington.
Hearing on September 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with Attorney Ryan J. Harrington.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Harrington requests an adjournment as he will be filing a motion to suppress next week.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with Attorney Ryan J. Harrington.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Sam Wegleitner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Harrington requests an adjournment as he is still reviewing discovery.  Court adjourns.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on July 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with attorney Ryan J Harrington.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court with attorney Ryan J Harrington.  Ted S Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with the co-actor listed in the complaint.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Kevin P Sheehan in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel. Defendant stated that he has hired Attorney Ryan Harrington.  Hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
